page.title: 13 Longhill Primary School
page.content:
The oldest children are 9. There are only 207 children in the primary now, but 120 in the nursery (60 attend mornings only, and 60 afternoons only) The primary children are in 9 classes. The smallest class has 17 children and the rest have between 20-29. In the primary school there are 9 class teachers and a head teacher. In the nursery there are two teachers and four nursery nurses teaching the children in six groups. A teacher visits the primary for several hours each week to help children with reading difficulties.
From 1988, the school, like all primary schools in Hull, will again have children up to the age of 11.
